basics.name: Keith Okuna
basics.label: Full Stack Engineer
basics.summary: Full stack engineer finishing school and expecting to graduate from UH Manoa in May 2022

work.summary: Full stack engineer using React and Go
Full stack engineer using Node and Windows WPF / ASP.NET
highlights: Rewrote licensing Node.js server supporting over 3,000 active licenses to use Stripe APIs; seamlessly migrated existing purchases into Stripe and preserved compatibility with legacy app
Designed and built two new Angular apps with Node.js backend: an account management page for users, and an admin dashboard to view and manage user accounts
Ongoing development with a complex Windows Presentation Foundation app in C# with an ASP.NET Core backend that communicates with the Node.js account server using an OAuth implementation
Assisted onboarding and training new developer through pair programming and code review

work.summary: In four weeks, created a Spark/Python/Airflow/MySQL data engineering pipeline running on parallel EC2 instances that analyzed hundreds of gigabytes of flight tracking data, in faster than real-time, to detect close calls between airplanes
highlights: Built a batching pipeline in four weeks to analyze ~300GB of air traffic radar data to detect near collisions of aircraft using AWS S3 for storage, Spark/Python for processing, and Aurelia/Node/MySQL for visualization
Tuned algorithm to efficiently reduce and compare nearly one million points of data per minute in faster than real time
Created a scheduling job in Airflow to allow the app to automatically ingest and process new data
Refactored undocumented LAMP (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP) project into the company’s first commercial software product and assisted with its delivery to the company’s first client
Revised user account permission system so that users did not need multiple accounts for different functions which improved application usability and greatly reduced technical support requests
